name: barley couscous
ingredients: Cinnamon stick or lemon (to flavor the cooking water, optional)
steps: Bring water to a boil in the bottom of the couscoussier (with cinnamon or lemon, if used).
In a large dish, spread the barley semolina. Sprinkle it with 200 ml of cold water. Roll the grains between your fingers. Let it swell for a few minutes.
Place the barley semolina in the top of the couscoussier for the first steaming. Steam for 20 minutes.
Transfer the grains to the large dish. Sprinkle with about 200 ml of cold water mixed with salt. Roll to separate the grains. Let cool.
Proceed with the third steaming (15-20 min).
Transfer the semolina back. Add the granulated sugar (if used) and the butter in pieces. Mix well.
Mix the warm semolina with the pomegranate seeds. Shape into a pyramid, decorate with walnuts and pomegranate. Optionally, drizzle with warm milk and sprinkle with powdered sugar.
